intro: Leucas zeylanica var. zeylanica, commonly known as Indian borage, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Its flowers are usually blue or violet, arranged in whorled clusters, and bloom during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and forest margins.
